contentHtml: The determinant of a matrix is a fundamental concept in linear algebra. In this theorem, we explore how row operations affect the value of the determinant.

theorem.proofSketch: The proof involves expanding the determinant of AB as a sum over permutations and matching it with the product of the determinants of A and B.

intuition: This theorem shows that the determinant is preserved under multiplication by an invertible matrix. This has important implications for many applications in machine learning, such as finding the volume of a parallelepiped or computing the inverse of a matrix.
